definitions: To invent a story, excuse, or lie.
To create or compose something, often spontaneously.
To compensate for something lost or missed.
examples: She had to make something up quickly when asked why she was late.
The band can make something up on the spot during their jam sessions.
After their argument, they decided to make something up and be friends again.
He worked extra hours to make something up for the time he missed.
